definition[0]: to refuse to accept or continue with something
example[0]: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
definition[1]: to state or show that something is not true or correct
example[1]: The book repudiates the racist stereotypes about black women.
definition[2]: to state that a contract, agreement, sale etc is no longer effective
example[2]: This would be a breach of a condition which would enable the hirer to repudiate the contract.
